name: The Newsroom (Season 3)
summary: In September 2013, Jeff Daniels and Thomas Sadoski stated that The Newsroom would return for a third season. HBO later clarified saying, "We are excited about proceeding to a Season 3 and are continuing our conversations with Aaron about schedules."On January 13, 2014, HBO officially confirmed the series was renewed for a third and final season, scheduled to premiere in fall 2014.

eps.name: Boston
eps.desc: The news team treats a breaking story about the Boston Marathon bombings with guarded caution, still reeling from the Genoa retraction, in hopes of regaining the public's trust back. Maggie is sent with Elliot to Boston to report at the scene and after Elliot has an allergic reaction, Maggie steps in to report on his behalf in impressive fashion. Sloan gets a special computer system that allows her review financial information in great detail, and immediately starts to use it in order to figure out what company may be bought out, a tip she got from a friend earlier in the day. Reese asks Sloan to "be kind" and think big picture when she reports on the state of the company. Reese gives her data showing heavy losses. Neal is contacted by an anonymous source and is eventually given thousands of confidential & stolen documents regarding riots overseas. In the final scene, Reese, Neal, Charlie, MacKenzie and Will discover Neal has likely assisted in committing espionage. Will is also informed that ACN went from the top News program down to 4th to which he responds by suggesting he quit. Sloan finally figures out that the company being taken over is ACN, and that they will be the victim of a hostile take over by his half siblings. Jim informs everyone that the 2nd suspect in the bombings was found in a boat in someone's back yard. Will then backtracks on his resignation, states that they will stand behind Reese and tells Neal to get some legal representation.

eps.name: Run
eps.desc: Charlie and Reese confronts Reese's half-siblings, Randy and Blair (Kat Dennings) about the hostile takeover. After some heated back-and-forth, Leona arrives and offers to buy their shares for a higher price. Neal and Will meet with Rebecca to discuss the potential espionage situation and Rebecca confirms that Neal has committed espionage. She and Will agree that ACN should not run the story so that Neal will not face any investigation. Mac asks her friend, Molly (Mary McCormack), an FBI agent about espionage charges and the media. Molly says no reporter has been charged with espionage, they are usually charged with contempt for not giving up the source and face an average jail time of 10 days. Mac tells Rebecca, Will and Neal they have to run the story. Maggie is on a train back from Boston and overhears an EPA employee, Richard (Paul Lieberstein), on the phone with a reporter. He makes disparaging remarks about the President, "off the record". Maggie reveals that she overheard, but Richard makes her feel bad about it and she says she'll delete her notes. Richard agrees to give her an "on the record" interview about a report that carbon dioxide levels are worse than they've ever been. Don informs Sloan that he purchased stock prior to Sloan reporting it in a newscast. Sloan fears that since they are a couple, it is against the ACN handbook. Sloan then inadvertently informs Jim that she's been sleeping with Don. Hallie sends a tweet from the ACN account making a joke in poor taste about the Boston Marathon and the Republicans. Though she deletes it, other news sources pick it up and Charlie fires her. After the ACN "brass" discuss Neal's situation with Rebecca, Will motions for Neal to leave the room with him. Will has realized that Neal has already confirmed a portion of the leak (concerning Equatorial Kundu), forcing ACN's hand. Will has Neal give him the name of his source and then tells him how to get out of town. As the FBI executes a search warrant on the ACN computers, Molly informs Mac, Will and Charlie that Neal will likely get the book thrown at him if he is found to have assisted the source in any way. Will has had a note was delivered to Neal, which tells him to run away. Neal is shown destroying his phone and the note. Takes place on April 20, 2013.

eps.name: Main Justice
eps.desc: The news team fake a live broadcast of the FBI raid on the newsroom in order to persuade them to stand down, which works. Charlie is informed by Leona and Reese that in order to keep the company running, they will need to sell ACN to Lucas Pruit (B. J. Novak), a libertarian billionaire. Don meets with the new HR rep, Wyatt (Keith Powell), who believes Don and Sloan are in a relationship. Maggie's segment on the EPA report goes on the air with Will interviewing Richard. However, the interview does not go well, as Richard continually remarks that the effect of human CO2 emissions into the atmosphere is unchangeable. Will, Mac, Charlie, and Rebecca meet with the Attorney General's representative in Washington to discuss Neal's situation, but Will does not offer up any information other than describing how he orchestrated much of the situation himself. At the White House Correspondents' Dinner, Charlie meets with Lucas to discuss buying the network. At the dinner, Mac is approached by a woman named Lily (Clea DuVall) who says, and then confirms, that she is Neal's source. Later at the dinner, Will is subpoenaed to appear before a grand jury. Takes place between April 20 and April 27, 2013.

eps.name: Contempt
eps.desc: Preparing to air the Kundu story, the team gets the first reporter who wrote the story, along with his family, out of the Middle East safely. Mac meets with Lily in Washington to ask her to extend the deadline to broadcast the story before she leaks it, but she does not promise to. The story is ready to air but Reese says they cannot run it. Pruitt tells the team his new vision for the company, including user-generated content, which Charlie does not like. Sloan and Don keep dodging the human resources rep, however he already knows they are dating. Sloan and Charlie try to find another buyer for ACN, but are unsuccessful when they find out the new buyer has just been using them as leverage to buy another company. Jim and Hallie fight over their views of journalism and break up after she writes about a fight they had for her new online column. Will continues to defy the government by refusing to name the source of the stolen documents and is held in contempt and sentenced to jail. Before he goes to jail, he and Mac get married at the courthouse. Takes place between April 27 and May 3, 2013.

eps.name: Oh Shenandoah
eps.desc: ACN continues its charge towards younger ratings by sending Don out to get a story on date rape and having Sloan interview Neal's temporary replacement about ACN's new celebrity sighting/stalking apps. Will, still serving his prison sentence for refusing to reveal his source, begins a troubling conversation with a new cell mate (Kevin Rankin), who is revealed through a picture of young Will and his father to be Will's vision of his dead father. Jim and Maggie try to track down Edward Snowden at a Russian airport and coincidentally end up confronting their own secrets, finally realizing their feelings for each other and kissing for the second time. Sloan's attempt to discredit Neal's temporary replacement on the air has the unforeseen consequence of Charlie's death. Takes place between May 3 and June 24, 2013.

eps.name: What Kind of Day Has It Been
eps.desc: Set around Charlie's funeral service and wake, a series of flashbacks show how his vision created the new format for News Night, how he hired Mac, how Mac told the young student at Will's first episode question and answer scene how to be the first at the microphone to ask a question, how Charlie led Will into becoming a better journalist, and other pre-series situations including Don and Sloan's first meeting. Neal returns from Venezuela and is disappointed at how the new team is running ACN Digital and tells them they are going to rebuild it. Leona talks Pruit into rectifying his emerging negative image with women by hiring Mac as the network president, replacing Charlie. Mac and Will find out that she is pregnant, and Will quits smoking as a result. Mac makes Jim the show's executive producer after offering the job to Don, who chooses to stay with and improve the 10 o'clock news show. Maggie is offered the senior producer job by Jim, but she still wants to be interviewed for the field producer job in Washington, D.C. The newsroom staff prepare and broadcast their next News Night. Takes place on June 27, 2013. Flashbacks take place three years earlier in 2010.
